Description: Large fragment of weft-faced, plain weave, undyed cotton cloth, now cream to tan, covered on one side with pile (C.5.5cm long) of twisted double threads, cut; warp-undyed cotton (S/c.4.5 pairs per cm), weft-undyed cotton (s/c.18-22 single per cm); pile weft-undyed cotton (S spun Z ply), one row of cut loop every c.26 picks, one cut pile on each two pairs of warp thread; reinforced selvedge with 2 groups of warp thread and extra circuits of main weft; other edges torn or ragged
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
